com.pump.image.gif.block

Class GifLoopingApplicationExtension

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.image.gif.block.GifBlock
      • com.pump.image.gif.block.GifExtensionBlock
        • com.pump.image.gif.block.GifApplicationExtension
          • com.pump.image.gif.block.GifLoopingApplicationExtension
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GifConstants

    public class GifLoopingApplicationExtension
extends GifApplicationExtension
    This is a special block that indicates how many times a GIF should loop.

    This is not defined in the GIF file format, but has become so standard that it might as well be. This is just an application extension with the header of "NETSCAPE2.0". The body of this block indicates how many loops should occur; note that in most cases this value will be LOOPS_FOREVER.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GifLoopingApplicationExtension

        public GifLoopingApplicationExtension(int loopCount)
        Creates a looping extension.
        Parameters:
        loopCount - the number of times this should loop. If this is greater than 65535, then this value is changed to LOOP_FOREVER.

      • GifLoopingApplicationExtension

        protected GifLoopingApplicationExtension(byte[] header,
                                         byte[] data)
        This constructor is not recommended for this object, since the bytes have to match up perfectly for this to be a valid looping block.
        Parameters:
        header - This must be "NETSCAPE2.0"
        data - This must be 0x01 followed by 2 bytes, representing an unsigned int.
